articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden welcomes the heads of NATO member states to Washington on Tuesday for an annual summit that gives the embattled Democrat an international stage to convince allies at home and abroad he can still lead.
articles.title: Biden NATO summit a chance to show voters, allies he can still lead

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Ramadan Abed
articles.description: Palestinians fled under Israeli fire as tanks thrust deeper into Gaza City on Tuesday while dozens were killed or wounded in an airstrike in the enclave's south as Israel stepped up an offensive that Hamas said could jeopardise ceasefire talks.
articles.title: Dozens of Gazans killed and wounded in Israeli assault that Hamas warns may threaten truce talks

articles.author: Ben Blanchard
articles.description: Chinese aircraft carrier the Shandong passed close to the northern Philippines on its way to drills in the Pacific, Taiwan's defence minister said on Wednesday, as Taipei reported dozens of warplanes joining the ship for exercises.
articles.title: Chinese carrier passes close to Philippines on way to Pacific drills, Taiwan says

articles.author: Olena Harmash, Max Hunder
articles.description: Donations poured in on Tuesday to help rebuild Kyiv's main children's hospital as Ukraine mourned at least 41 people killed during a major Russian missile assault on the Ukrainian capital and other cities a day earlier.
articles.title: Donations pour in as Ukraine mourns dozens killed in Russian air attack

articles.author: Lisa Barrington
articles.description: North Korea's trash balloon campaign, missile launches and the emergence of GPS "spoofing" have increased risks in South Korean airspace, aviation experts say, complicating airline operations as tensions rise between the rival nations.
articles.title: North Korea balloons, GPS interference raise safety risks for airlines

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy urged U.S. political leaders in Washington on Tuesday not to wait for the outcome of America's November presidential election to move forcefully to aid his country against Russia's invasion.
articles.title: Don't wait for November to aid Ukraine, Zelenskiy urges in Washington address

articles.author: Steve Holland, Kanishka Singh
articles.description: The United States and its allies will deliver to Ukraine five additional air defense systems, including Patriot missile batteries and Patriot components, the leaders of those countries said in a joint statement during the NATO summit.
articles.title: US, allies announce additional air defense systems for Ukraine

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: More than 130 people including tourists were trapped in Tibet near China's rugged Himalayan border with Nepal on Wednesday after incessant rains unleashed landslides and floods, severing road links, according to Chinese state media.
articles.title: Storms trap more than 130 near China's Tibetan border with Nepal

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: NATO has placed an order for Stinger anti-aircraft missiles worth almost $700 million in the name of several member states, the alliance's Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg said on Tuesday.
articles.title: NATO agency places $700 mln order for Stinger anti-aircraft missiles

articles.author: Brendan O'Brien, Ismail Shakil
articles.description: Millions of Americans in southeast Texas endured brutally hot conditions on Tuesday without the relief of air conditioning after deadly Tropical Storm Beryl knocked out power to a large portion of the region.
articles.title: Heat wave bakes Texas amid power outages while Canada braces for wildfires
